text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Kafr El Sheikh Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Flag of Kafr El-Sheikh Governorate.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of arms of Kafr El-Sheikh Governorate.jpg | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Kafr el-Sheikh in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Kafr El Sheikh Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Kafr El Sheikh (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 3,437 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 3414000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Kafr El Sheikh Governorate is a governorate of Egypt. The capital city is also named Kafr El Sheikh. The governorate is located in the far north of the country on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea. Kafr El Sheikh Governorate was once part of the Gharbia Governorate. It was created in 1949. ==Cities and towns== Lake Burullus is in the north of the Kafr El Sheikh governorate. The following cities are in Kafr El Sheikh: * El Hamool * Baltim * Bila * Desouk * Fuwwah * Kafr El Sheikh * Metoubes * Qallin * El Reyad * Sidi Salem ==Notable residents== * Hamdeen Sabahi * Mohamed Atta * Ahmed Zewail * Saad Zaghloul ==References== Category:20th-century establishments in Egypt Category:1949 establishments
title: Kafr El Sheikh Governorate
